comments.html: One more promising congestion control algorithm is BBR (Bottleneck Bandwidth RRT), which is interesting, that it pays no attention in congestion window at all, it uses just real bandwidth per last three RTTs and resets this time to time to reflect real case (bandwidth can vary with time). What do you think, Ivan, about this new algorithm?

comments.name: Dave Taht

comments.html:
Shaping and policing is not an exclusive OR problem. On the egress you use shaping, on the ingress you use policing. They should always go in pairs to ensure that design contracts are implemented properly on a link.
However, shaping may introduce extra IP packet delay variation at each hop, so you may want to limit your shaping/policing pairs only to those links where a congestion could really happen.
Most network connections in LANs or core networks are oversized, so congestion would never happen there. On such links shaping/policing should not be configured.

If there is a policing, but no corresponding shaping, then I would write a material audit finding in my audit report... :-)
comments.name: Bela

comments.html: The simplified rule is: shaping AND policing. Always!
